name: airpods-noise-control
title: AirPods Noise Control
description: Toggle between Noise Cancellation and Transparency on your AirPods.
author: chrahe

commands.name: index
commands.title: Toggle Noise Control Mode
commands.description: This command will toggle between your preferred two Noise Control modes if AirPods are connected to your device.

preferences.name: toggleA
preferences.title: 🟢 Primary Mode Position
preferences.description: This Noise Control mode will be activated on toggle if your AirPods are in any other mode.

preferences.name: toggleB
preferences.title: 🔵 Secondary Mode Position
preferences.description: This Noise Control mode will be activated on toggle if your AirPods are in the Primary mode.

commands.name: cycle
commands.title: Cycle Noise Control Mode
commands.description: This command will cycle through the available Noise Control modes if AirPods are connected to your device.

preferences.name: hasAdaptive
preferences.title: Adaptive Mode
preferences.description: Is Adaptive Noise Control available on your AirPods? (AirPods Pro 2nd gen on macOS 14+)
preferences.label: Adaptive Mode available

preferences.name: airpodsIndex
preferences.title: AirPods List Position
preferences.description: When your AirPods are connected, at which position are they listed in your Sound menu? (1, 2, 3, etc.)

preferences.name: ccLoc
preferences.title: Control Center Localization
preferences.description: What is the name of the Control Center in your language/region?

preferences.name: soundLoc
preferences.title: Sound Menu Localization
preferences.description: What is the name of the Sound menu (in Control Center) in your language/region?

preferences.name: expandOffset
preferences.title: AirPods Expander UI Offset
preferences.description: Only change this if the command is expanding the Noise Control menu on the wrong set of AirPods. Try odd values between -1 and 5.
